intro: Hernandia temarii, commonly known as the Temarii hernandia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the Philippines and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant in tropical rainforests, preferring humid and shaded environments. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
